intro: Ludwigia hirtella, commonly known as the hairy Ludwigia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically range in color from yellow to orange. The plant features opposite, hairy leaves that are often covered in fine, short hairs, giving it its common name. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Ludwigia hirtella is also appreciated as an ornamental plant in gardens and aquatic environments.
